name: Boeing International Corporation - Belgium Branch Office
bossPosition: Managing Director - EU & NATO Government Affairs
goal:
As a partner, customer and supplier, Boeing and it's affiliated entities have actively participated in the European aerospace community for more than 75 years, contributing to – and benefiting from – its tradition of innovation and excellence.
Today Boeing has offices across Europe with approximately 4000 employees in 17 European countries who support up to 200,000 high-tech jobs boosting the development of knowledge-based economies. Boeing is building its presence on the ground with investments in new facilities, leading-edge research and development, economic, environmental and social programs that support the European Union’s long-term goals and stronger transatlantic partnerships in defense, civil aviation, space and communications.
Boeing is committed to building constructive relationships with the EU decision-makers to promote aerospace as a global industry and an essential element of European competitiveness and growth. Together with our industry partners, we work to strengthen the role of aerospace in Europe and in the global economy, and focus on issues of mutual interest, such as the environment, air traffic management (ATM), airworthiness and safety, trade, technology, defense and security.
interests: Business and Industry, Competition, Energy, Environment, Foreign affairs and security policy, Institutional affairs, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Research and innovation, Single market, Trade, Trans-European Networks, Transport
euInitiatives:
Climate policies
Environmental legislation
Air Traffic Management
Transportation policies
Air Transport
Aviation Safety
Aviation Security
Energy
Defense market issues
Homeland Security
Research & technology
